Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC). The MIC of the extracts were evaluated against selected Gram positive ( Bacillus pumilus, Staphylococcus aureus and Staphylococcus epidermidis) and Gram negative bacteria ( Klebsiella pneumoniae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Escherichia coli) by microdilution method, as described by Mohsenipour et al.
21 . The bacterial concentration in the inoculum was standardized at 0.5 McFarland turbidity scale, (1 Ã— 10 8 CFU/ml).
